page.title: 19BLACK SHUCK.
page.content: {Black Shuck}is supposed to be a large {black dog}that{roams the cliffs}from Beeston Regis Church to Bacton Church looking for its{two masters drowned}at sea, one buried in each churchyard. It is said to have{one blazing eye}in the middle of its forehead, and if you see it it's a sign of{impending death. The old Sheringham{smugglers}used this{legend}to keep the public away when they were on a smuggling run at Beeston. They used a{Shetland pony, hung a{lantern}between its ears, attached it to a long line and ran the pony as the "Old Shuck" of the legend all along the cliff until the smuggled {cargo was landed}and safely got away. Several poems have been written on this legend and there are variations of the story to be found in other parts of Norfolk.
